scenario: The stock market had a strong day on Tuesday with the S&P 500 up 0.8% and the Nasdaq Composite up 0.52%. Brighthouse Financial (BHF) was a major standout, up 16% after rising 25% earlier in the session. The company is working with investment bankers to either raise minority equity or sell the entire company, with a preference for the latter. Brighthouse was spun off from MetLife eight years ago and specializes in variable annuities, but its complex product nature may be a roadblock to a potential deal. The company's $120 billion investment portfolio could be appealing to larger alternative asset managers. There is no guarantee a deal will happen, but a more regulatory-friendly climate may lead to increased M&A activity in 2025.
